result.execSummary:
The defendant Terral L Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Terral L Martin in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Terral L Martin in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties have reviewed PSI along with the letters. The State notes corrections on the record. 

BTC: 15CF311 - Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, consec if revoked - STAYED. 3 yrs probation conc with any other probation
         15CF776 - 6 mos RCJ/CFTS. Huber is granted for employment and child care. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety.
         15CF1146, Ct 1 - 1 yr RCJ, conc with 15CF776
                             Ct 2 - Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, consec if revoked -STAYED. 3 yrs probation conc with any other probation

costs

Defendant Terral L Martin in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Terral L Martin in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
In 15CF311-Pl to charge; state recommends probation. In 15CF776-pl to charge; state recommends 6 mos RCJ. In 15cf1146-pl to Cts 1 & 2, balance are DRI. Ct 1-State recommends 1 yr RCJ conc with 6 mos in 15CF776 and on Ct 2-4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES-I/S - 3 yrs probation.
P-G to ALL
COP filed, rights given
deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Ct 1: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Terral L Martin in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties previously agreed that deft would turn himself into RCJ after a positive test after his last appearance. Since that time, deft has allowed the GPS unit to totally discharge, has never resumed charging the GPS bracelet so he basically has absconded. State asks for bond modifications and the State intends to file additional charges. Defense asks for COP  

BTC: Bonds to be modified to $2,500.00 cash - same terms and conditions as previously ordered. Defendant taken into custody

Plea hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
